org.ink.core.vm.factory
Class InkVM

java.lang.Object
  org.ink.core.vm.factory.InkVM
All Implemented Interfaces:
VM
public class InkVM
extends java.lang.Object
implements VM

The entry point to the Ink Virtual Machine.
Use the instance() method to retrieve the singleton instance of InkVM.
Example: 

     InkVM.instance().getContext().getObject("ink.tutorial1:Active_offers");

Author:
Lior Schachter

Method Detail

instance

public static VM instance()
Returns the singleton instance of the Ink Virtual Machine. Use this method to retrieve the entry point to the Ink VM, which allows fetching of Context and DslFactory objects.
Example: 
     InkVM.instance().getContext().getState("ink.tutorial1:Active_offers").getBehavior();

Returns:
the singleton instance of the Ink Virtual Machine.

instance

public static VM instance(java.lang.String defaultNamespace,
                          java.lang.String[] paths)
Returns the singleton instance of the Ink Virtual Machine, initialized with the specified namespace and list of file paths.
Application code should use the instance() method instead of this one.
The supplied parameters have no effect if the singleton has already been initialized.

Parameters:
defaultNamespace - the default Ink namespace for the VM. May be null.
paths - a list of paths to the dsls.ink metadata files (those files are normally handled by Ink itself). May be null.
Returns:
the singleton instance of the Ink Virtual Machine, initialized with the specified namespace and list of file paths.

getContext

public Context getContext()
Description copied from interface: VM
Retrieves the default Context object of the running Ink VM.

Specified by:
getContext in interface VM
Returns:
the Context of the default DSL factory.

getFactory

public DslFactory getFactory()
Description copied from interface: VM
Returns the default DslFactory.

Specified by:
getFactory in interface VM
Returns:
the default DslFactory.

destroy

public static void destroy()
Shuts down the Ink Virtual Machine and clears all its resources. It's not necessary to explicitly shut down the Ink VM; it will shut down normally upon JVM exit.

getInstanceFactory

public static InstanceFactory getInstanceFactory()
Returns the default InstanceFactory of the Ink VM.

Returns:
the default InstanceFactory of the Ink VM.

getOwnerFactory

public DslFactory getOwnerFactory(java.io.File f)
Description copied from interface: VM
Returns the DslFactory associated with the required source file.

Specified by:
getOwnerFactory in interface VM
Parameters:
f - a source file (.ink).
Returns:
the DslFactory associated with the source file, or null if no such factory is found.

introduceNewDSl

public void introduceNewDSl(java.lang.String path)
                     throws InkException
Description copied from interface: VM
Loads a new DslFactory and adds it to the running Ink VM. This also loads the new factory's dependencies (i.e. additional DSL factories).

Specified by:
introduceNewDSl in interface VM
Parameters:
path - the path to the dsls.ink metadata file (those files are normally handled by Ink itself).
Throws:
InkException - if the factory couldn't be loaded successfully.

getFactory

public DslFactory getFactory(java.lang.String namespace)
Description copied from interface: VM
Returns the DslFactory of the required namespace.

Specified by:
getFactory in interface VM
Parameters:
namespace - the namespace of the factory, such as ink.core.
Returns:
the DslFactory of the required namespace, or null if no factory is bound for the namespace.

Description copied from interface: VM
Collects the parsing and validation errors from all the namespaces loaded to the Ink VM.

collectErrors in interface VM
Returns:
a list of parsing and validation errors from all the namespaces.

reloadDSL

public void reloadDSL(java.lang.String namespace)
Description copied from interface: VM
Re-scans and reloads the DslFactory of the required namespace. Has no effect if the namespace is not found.

Specified by:
reloadDSL in interface VM
Parameters:
namespace - the namespace of the factory, such as ink.core.
